name: Gochan
description: A semi-standalone Futaba-style imageboard server written in Go. Gochan is designed to be highly configurable, with video embed support, post filters, Go and Lua plugins, etc.

name: GD6502
description: A 6502 emulator written in GDScript using the Godot game engine

name: QtSphere IDE
description: A cross-platform IDE/resource editor for the Sphere game engine using the Qt toolkit via PySide6

name: OmniChip-8
description: A CHIP-8 emulator with the goal of being compatible with as many systems as possible. It currently supports SDL2, (n)curses, GameBoy, Commodore 64, and WebAssembly.

name: Eggbertx’s Challenge
description: A Chip’s Challenge implementation written in GDScript using the Godot game engine

name: Thy Dungeonman (Apple II/IIe demake)
description: A demake of Thy Dungeonman for Apple II and Apple II Enhanced. Thy Dungeonman is a flash game that parodies traditional text adventure games.

name: Simple 3D Raycaster
description: A simple project to teach myself how to do traditional Wolfenstein 3D style raycasting, as well as CMake usage

name: Territories Game
description: A package and sample program that manages a Risk-style territorial conquest game. It is not yet ready for public use, but it is a work in progress.

name: go-forms
description: A package for simplifying validation and parsing HTTP forms into Go structs
